message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.ITP. 

The paper deals with entropy, coding theory, and information theory, which are all subfields of computer science. Specifically, it focuses on the analysis of polar codes, which are used in channel coding, a subfield of information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves the analysis of codes for discrete memoryless channels, which falls under the category of channel coding (cs.CC). The use of sumset inequalities and the analysis of entropy suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the subfields of discrete mathematics (cs.DS) and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper involves the analysis of the convergence to Shannon capacity, which is a topic in computational complexity theory (cs.ITP).
